tasks.title: RB-2741 Question:  Addition to list of HoH w/ no Client Location
tasks.notes: Please find the attached file.  The customer is requesting that we add to this report the Head Of Household ID of those HoH who have null for HoH Client Location.  They indicate that this would assist them in fixing the records faster so we may run the script associated with RB-2718.

originalStatus.name: In Progress

originalComments.author: Natalie
originalComments.body:
Hi [~dougt],

Reporting an issue, please include instance name in the task description. It will be a great help for the report developer. Thank you! I can say that the issue is in OC instance only because OC is mentioned in the related task. But I can be mistaken with my prediction in the future.

----

I've run:
*1)* script to fix HoH where possible;
*2)* script to set [client_location] = CA-602 for all HoHs without [client_location];

Here is modified [^Updated File.xlsx] with:
- HoH existance answer
- HoH's client location

there are 23 Households with 65 project stays *without HoH* and, as a result, without HoH's client location. Please ask Customer to fix HoH for these project stays (I've highlighted them with yellow background) and then I re-run fix client_location script again.

Best regards,
Natalie

Natalie

originalComments.author: dougt
originalComments.body:
[~Natalie], the customer and I have done some spotchecking and were able to find > 6 records that should have been updated.  The rows highlighted in green within the attached spreadsheet are those that I have confirmed have have HoH in the enrollments.

I did also notice some other oddities in red.
* 8740C0649 is included in the spreadsheet but this client doesn't have any enrollments in their record at all.
* 32C7E8A9B,  5E5C6B7B7,  94D6FF807 are listed int he spreadsheet as having an enrollment on 02/06/2018, however their clarity record has then starting on 04/07/2018	.

 [^SpotCheckResults.xlsx]

originalComments.author: Natalie
originalComments.body:
Hi [~dougt],

When you submit a comment, please, assign the task to the receiver. If it is not re-assigned, in most cases it is possible to overlook the comment especially if we need something to be done urgently.

Here is one example from your excel document with green rows:
Client 724CC8F30 in "Transitional Housing Program" household with client 1BF993560. The Household issue is that *both* clients are marked as "Head of Household" ([relationship_to_hoh] = 1). In Clarity app the first one record is displayed, but, in fact, in DB both records are HoHs.
https://oc.clarityhs.com/clients/24721/programs/35626/log
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
https://oc.clarityhs.com/clients/24728/programs/35627/log
!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

If Customer removes exit date, he will be able to open HH relationship popup and will be able to see that *both HH members are HoHs*.

----

Client 3298F25B2 is in "Emergency Shelter Program" project household with 3 other members. Clarity app display first found HoH on the right panel, but if you open the HH relationship popup, you will see *two HoHs: CBB23E188 and E6C22F603*. {color:green}*Household should have only one HoH at the same time. Any other case is HoH issue.*{color}

----

Clients 1CD30BA85 ([relationship_to_hoh] = 2) and 0CB958E0F ([relationship_to_hoh] = 1) and in the "Emergency Shelter Program" household. Client 0CB958E0F has [client_location] = CA-602. It is possible this household was updated last time I ran the script (6 households were updated).

----

bq. 8740C0649 is included in the spreadsheet but this client doesn't have any enrollments in their record at all.
>>>If Client doesn't have any project stay on June 26, but the client was reported in the file generated on June 8, then maybe *client's project stay(s) were deleted* within [June, 8 - June, 26]?
Please take a look at deleted client's programs ( https://oc.clarityhs.com/clients/26630/programs/deleted/1 ):
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 
we can see two project stays were *deleted after the file had been generated*.

----

bq. 32C7E8A9B, 5E5C6B7B7, 94D6FF807 are listed int he spreadsheet as having an enrollment on 02/06/2018, however their clarity record has then starting on 04/07/2018
>>>Please take a look at deleted client's programs ( https://oc.clarityhs.com/clients/3089/programs/deleted/1 ):
!screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 
Project stay was deleted on 06/11/2018, but the file with project stays was generated on 06/08/2018 - before the project stay was deleted.

----

I suggest you and Customer to go throught next steps:
1) run [HUDX-225] HMIS Data Quality Report to use actual project stays
2) open drilldown for "Q3. Relationship to Head of Household"
3) fix HoHs with issue
4) go throught steps 1 - 3 until "Q3. Relationship to Head of Household" = 0
5) ask us to fix Client Location for HoHs.
6) done.

Best regards,
Natalie

Does the export/import handle stand alone services??

If you choose not to map an item, what happens to that data? Is it just kicked out?  Can we see that data somehow?

* Full Matching -When enabled, the import process will take the client records being imported and compare them with client records already in the Clarity system.  An exact match will need to be made on a client's First Name, Last Name, DOB, and SSN.  If an exact match is not made, the client record and associated data will not be imported, and no client data will be created or updated.

tasks.title: RB-2749 TIME:  YFHPI - Update Request for [KCWA-105] YFHPI Evaluation Random Assignment
tasks.notes:
[~Natalie] -

The customer is asking for more changes... We are going to do an SOW this time... sigh. Please estimate how much time it would take to implement the following:

* Change randomization to only randomize for those with scores >14 and <29
* Change the hierarchy of the error messages to the following:
# If client has no signed ROI, then display *ROI message*.
# If client has a signed ROI but no Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the *Homeless Prevention Risk Tool* message.
# If client has a signed ROI and a completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool but no consent form, then display the *consent form* message.
# If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or above 29  completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the *score eligibility* message.
# Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored 15-28 on the risk tool, display *their group assignment*

Original request:

{quote}instance: kingcounty.clarityhs.com
report: \[KCWA-105\] YFHPI Evaluation Random Assignment
UI: 0140D9140
Reference: RB-2595 & RB-2708
Issue:
Customer is reporting that the client with a score of 30 on the assessment should not be randomized; because only clients with a score of 15-28 should be randomized. The logic will need to be updated as another change to the specifications, i.e score is > 28?  For reference, see RB-2595 :

bq. Logic and display of report results:
bq. 1. The client has a client consent form saved to their client record 
bq. The client has an assessment score > 14
bq. Result: 
bq. No change

Also, customer would like to ensure the hierarchy below applied is applied to error messages.


Customer writes:
We just saw a client (ID# 0140D9140) scored a 30 but was randomized into group B. I believe we had set it up so that only clients who score between 15-28 are eligible to be randomized, and an error message would appear for clients who score below 15 or above 28. Can you please check to make sure this error message is still in place?

In terms of the hierarchy of error messages, it would fall as follows:
# If client has no signed ROI, then display ROI message.
# If client has a signed ROI but no Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the Homeless Prevention Risk Tool message.
# If client has a signed ROI and a completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool but no consent form, then display the consent form message.
# If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or above 29  completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the score eligibility message.
# Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored 15-28 on the risk tool, display their group assignment J{quote}


      
      ~* Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.~

originalStatus.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

originalComments.author: Natalie
originalComments.body:
Hi [~dougt],

Client 201DADDA4 *does* have Consent form ( https://kingcounty.clarityhs.com/clients/5526/files ):
!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!

Client 201DADDA4 has an assessment with score = 17 ( https://kingcounty.clarityhs.com/clients/5526/assessments ):
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

Not sure why I didn't notice it before but I have a question about score = 29. In most cases score = 29 is valid for Client to be plased in group. Please read task description:
bq. Change randomization to only randomize for those with scores >14 and *<29*
bq. If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or *above 29* completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the score eligibility message.
bq. Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored *15-28* on the risk tool, display their group assignment

It looks like "above 29" should be replaced with "above 28". Here can be the report issue because score = 29 was programmed as a valid score. Maybe that was the case? I've fixed the report. Could you please ask Customer to review?

Thank you,
Natalie

backlogTasks.title: CUST-129 SF - System Admin Request:  Branded Help Center vs Clarity Help Center
backlogTasks.notes:
It appears that when you are on a branded help center site (https://onesf.clarityhs.help/), clicking through to view articles sends you to the main Clarity Help Center (https://get.clarityhs.help/).  As a result of this forwarding functionality, it appears that search queries do not appear to work when made from the SF Help Center site.

For example...
# Go to https://onesf.clarityhs.help/
# Enter "client" into the search bar and you receive a couple of results specific to SF
# Go to https://get.clarityhs.help/
# Enter "client" into the search bar and you receive several pages of relevant search results.


* Discuss the relationship with the branded and Clarity sites when it comes to articles with Jeff.
* See what we can do to tie the branded help center sites closer to the Clarity help center articles through search.
* SF does not want the Help Desk to refer users to the Clarity Help Center to get the information they need creating a "you can find some stuff here and other stuff there" scenario between the sites.  Forwarding to the Bitfocus subdomain is not a concern.
* Report back to Jason

originalComments.author: dougt
originalComments.body: Combinator currently being configured to allow for main helpcenter articles to be shared with individual.  Awaiting more information from Jeff.

backlogTasks.title: CUST-176 SA Communities: Monthly Newsletters
backlogTasks.notes:
From Sarah Dougherty:
One thing that many of our SA communities are interested in is sending out a regular monthly newsletter. We do one in King County, but we are the only one. However, lots of our content is generic enough that it could be shared across communities. We recently discussed, as a first step, whether someone could just paste the generic content from our newsletter into templates in our other communities so that they'd have a foundation to build on and less of a barrier to actually sending something out. I think our other teams were planning to talk to you about this, so I just wanted to let you know that we are happy to have our content be shared if this is something you end up taking on. (I know that back before you were hired, this was one of the things we talked about your position doing, but I don't know if that's shifted at all).

originalStatus.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
originalStatus.name: In Progress

originalComments.author: dougt
originalComments.body:
Hello Doug! 

Thank you for reaching out to MailChimp Support and thank you for those details in the email. I'm happy to talk about how this could be set up in MailChimp. 

To answer your direct question, yes there is the functionality within MailChimp to do this! 

I was thinking that each group could have their own list that contains the email addresses that are in that distribution list. You could have one standard email template that is saved within the "Templates" tab and then whenever a person in a specific group goes to create a campaign, they can select this template that is saved and can edit it to make it personalized to their group. They can then send out that campaign just to the list that is designated for their group. Each list is independent from the other so one email address can be in multiple lists and can be sent multiple campaigns from each list. 

The other thing I was thinking that would be helpful is that we have different user levels. For example, an author user level can only create and edit campaigns but they can't send out campaigns. Here is our article that goes into the different user levels and how to add in users and change user levels: Manage User Levels in Your Account: http://eepurl.com/cEkjG9 

I checked out the account and see that it's on the monthly plan. This includes unlimited sending so you can send however many campaigns you would like. The billing is based on the total subscriber count across all lists so for example if there was 1000 subscribers in one list and then 1000 subscribers in another list, that would come to a total of 2000 subscribers for the entire account. 

Certainly if you have any other questions around this or run into any issues, please feel free to reach out through this email and I'd be happy to help in any way that I can. We also have chat support available if you'd like more immediate help and myself or another agent would be happy to help out! 

I hope you have a good rest of your day! 

Thank you,
Kimberly

backlogTasks.title: HC-150 HC: Public/Private in Client Profile
RB-2740 TIME:  Custom Program Performance Report (OC)
backlogTasks.notes:
Customer is requesting a canned report to use as their Program Performance Report that has the ability to show the performance percentage by project type and individual project, and also the raw data/details used in calculating the measures.

Customer has provided an example of the current report: https://public.tableau.com/profile/casey.parnis#!/vizhome/2016HMISProjectPerformanceReport/FinalFinalPPR?publish=yes

Attached is an example of the report as requested from OC on May 5th. This is to serve example of what they were picturing for the summary report. The other three tabs contain the headers from their previous analysis spreadsheets with the columns that they created highlighted.

1.	Entries From Homelessness - Head of Household enrollments active during the reporting period that entered a qualifying project type from Type of Residence considered "homeless." 
2.	Successful Exits - Enrollments that exited from a qualifying project type to a Destination that is considered "successful" according to the HUD System Performance Report Programming Specifications (pg 40-41). 
3.	Leavers with Increased Income - Adult enrollments that increased their income (not including non-cash benefits) during their stay in a qualifying project and exited during the reporting period. 
4.	Stayers with Increased Income - Adult enrollments with a stay of at least 365 days that increased their income (not including non-cash benefits) during their stay in a qualifying project and were still enrolled in the project as of the end of the reporting period. 
5.	Enrollments that exited from an Other Permanent Housing or Permanent Supportive Housing project during the reporting period and have a permanent housing Destination OR enrollments in an Other Permanent Housing or Permanent Supportive Housing project that have remained in the project as of the end of the reporting period. 
6.	Recidivism - Enrollments of clients who exited a project during a two year period prior to the end of the reporting period and later returned to a project that qualified them as "homeless" at least 14 days after exiting from the original project. 
7.	Average Length of Stay - The average number of days between program start date and program end date OR the last day of the reporting period for all enrollments. 
8.	Average Number of Days to PH Placement - The average number of days between an enrollment's program start date and its Housing Move-In Date. 
9.	Unit Utilization - The number of bed nights provided by a project during the reporting period divided by the number of the number of the project's maximum number of possible bed nights during the reporting period.

Customer will provide more detailed specs for the above items upon approval.

originalStatus.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software
originalStatus.name: SOW - Done

originalComments.author: Natalie
originalComments.body:
Hi [~dougt] and [~michelleo],

If Customer expects this new Clarity custom report work as on the screen:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
then we cannot provide the report with such graphics.

If everybody agree with our standard report layout (program name as a row and aggregate numbers for "Entries From Homelessness", "Successful Exits" etc columns), then to provide an estimate I need to know:
- should it be agency or admin or both agency/admin reports;
- what prompts fields Customer wants to have;
- report layout template;
- how project stays should be selected;
- what project stays should be reported (all or the most recent one etc.)
- what columns should be included in the drilldown?

Ideally, we need at least one test client with several different projects stays to test report with different scenarios.

*Raw estimate is 24-30h.* But it can be corrected after we get more details from Customer.

Best regards,
Natalie

I also have a request for this report to have a time estimate for being built on the Looker platform as well to leverage its visualization features.  Your suggestion is the proposed direction based on Pentaho's existing functionality.  Many thanks for looking at this!!

{quote}
*Should the report be agency or admin or both agency/admin versions of the reports?*
{color:blue}Can you clarify what this means? We want the report to be available to all users but for them to only be able to see their own agency’s data, and we want our (System) accounts to be able to run the report for all agencies.{color}
{quote}

{quote}
What prompt fields does the customer want to have in order to pull data in?{color:blue}
o	Agency (with Select All option)
o	Program (with Select All option)

o	End Date{color}
{quote}
>>>Looking on your example I think prompts page should be:
*+agency prompts page:*+

- Project Type
- Program(s)

- Report End Date

- Agency(ies)
- Project Status
- Project Type
- Program(s)
- Report Start Date
- Report End Date
- Report Output Format

{quote}
Report layout template.  If the suggestion above works, simply confirm. {color:blue}This is good, is it possible to also include the row for each project type and aggregate data for each measure based on the programs in each project type for the agency/agencies the report was run for?{color}
{quote}
>>>Sure, it is possible. Would you like to have it as:
||Program||	Entries From Homelessnes||Successful Exits||Leavers with Increased Income
||Project Type ||NNN||NNN||NNN
|Program1|NNN|NNN|NNN

OR

||Project Type - wide row
|Program1|NNN|NNN|NNN
|ProgramK|NNN|NNN|NNN
|*Total*|*NNN*|*NNN*|*NNN*

----

From the google doc it looks like we should use all project stays active within report date range that can cause Client be counted in both Leaver and Stayer. Are you sure we shouldn't look at most recent project stay?

Best regards,
Natalie

backlogTasks.title: RB-2749 TIME:  YFHPI - Update Request for [KCWA-105] YFHPI Evaluation Random Assignment
backlogTasks.notes:
[~Natalie] -

The customer is asking for more changes... We are going to do an SOW this time... sigh. Please estimate how much time it would take to implement the following:

* Change randomization to only randomize for those with scores >14 and <29
* Change the hierarchy of the error messages to the following:
# If client has no signed ROI, then display *ROI message*.
# If client has a signed ROI but no Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the *Homeless Prevention Risk Tool* message.
# If client has a signed ROI and a completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool but no consent form, then display the *consent form* message.
# If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or above 29  completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the *score eligibility* message.
# Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored 15-28 on the risk tool, display *their group assignment*

Original request:

{quote}instance: kingcounty.clarityhs.com
report: \[KCWA-105\] YFHPI Evaluation Random Assignment
UI: 0140D9140
Reference: RB-2595 & RB-2708
Issue:
Customer is reporting that the client with a score of 30 on the assessment should not be randomized; because only clients with a score of 15-28 should be randomized. The logic will need to be updated as another change to the specifications, i.e score is > 28?  For reference, see RB-2595 :

bq. Logic and display of report results:
bq. 1. The client has a client consent form saved to their client record 
bq. The client has an assessment score > 14
bq. Result: 
bq. No change

Also, customer would like to ensure the hierarchy below applied is applied to error messages.


Customer writes:
We just saw a client (ID# 0140D9140) scored a 30 but was randomized into group B. I believe we had set it up so that only clients who score between 15-28 are eligible to be randomized, and an error message would appear for clients who score below 15 or above 28. Can you please check to make sure this error message is still in place?

In terms of the hierarchy of error messages, it would fall as follows:
# If client has no signed ROI, then display ROI message.
# If client has a signed ROI but no Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the Homeless Prevention Risk Tool message.
# If client has a signed ROI and a completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool but no consent form, then display the consent form message.
# If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or above 29  completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the score eligibility message.
# Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored 15-28 on the risk tool, display their group assignment J{quote}


      
      ~* Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.~

backlogTasks.title: CUST-129 SF - System Admin Request:  Branded Help Center vs Clarity Help Center
backlogTasks.notes:
It appears that when you are on a branded help center site (https://onesf.clarityhs.help/), clicking through to view articles sends you to the main Clarity Help Center (https://get.clarityhs.help/).  As a result of this forwarding functionality, it appears that search queries do not appear to work when made from the SF Help Center site.

For example...
# Go to https://onesf.clarityhs.help/
# Enter "client" into the search bar and you receive a couple of results specific to SF
# Go to https://get.clarityhs.help/
# Enter "client" into the search bar and you receive several pages of relevant search results.


* Discuss the relationship with the branded and Clarity sites when it comes to articles with Jeff.
* See what we can do to tie the branded help center sites closer to the Clarity help center articles through search.
* SF does not want the Help Desk to refer users to the Clarity Help Center to get the information they need creating a "you can find some stuff here and other stuff there" scenario between the sites.  Forwarding to the Bitfocus subdomain is not a concern.
* Report back to Jason

originalComments.author: dougt
originalComments.body: Combinator currently being configured to allow for main helpcenter articles to be shared with individual.  Awaiting more information from Jeff.

backlogTasks.title: CUST-176 SA Communities: Monthly Newsletters
backlogTasks.notes:
From Sarah Dougherty:
One thing that many of our SA communities are interested in is sending out a regular monthly newsletter. We do one in King County, but we are the only one. However, lots of our content is generic enough that it could be shared across communities. We recently discussed, as a first step, whether someone could just paste the generic content from our newsletter into templates in our other communities so that they'd have a foundation to build on and less of a barrier to actually sending something out. I think our other teams were planning to talk to you about this, so I just wanted to let you know that we are happy to have our content be shared if this is something you end up taking on. (I know that back before you were hired, this was one of the things we talked about your position doing, but I don't know if that's shifted at all).

originalStatus.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
originalStatus.name: In Progress

originalComments.author: dougt
originalComments.body:
Hello Doug! 

Thank you for reaching out to MailChimp Support and thank you for those details in the email. I'm happy to talk about how this could be set up in MailChimp. 

To answer your direct question, yes there is the functionality within MailChimp to do this! 

I was thinking that each group could have their own list that contains the email addresses that are in that distribution list. You could have one standard email template that is saved within the "Templates" tab and then whenever a person in a specific group goes to create a campaign, they can select this template that is saved and can edit it to make it personalized to their group. They can then send out that campaign just to the list that is designated for their group. Each list is independent from the other so one email address can be in multiple lists and can be sent multiple campaigns from each list. 

The other thing I was thinking that would be helpful is that we have different user levels. For example, an author user level can only create and edit campaigns but they can't send out campaigns. Here is our article that goes into the different user levels and how to add in users and change user levels: Manage User Levels in Your Account: http://eepurl.com/cEkjG9 

I checked out the account and see that it's on the monthly plan. This includes unlimited sending so you can send however many campaigns you would like. The billing is based on the total subscriber count across all lists so for example if there was 1000 subscribers in one list and then 1000 subscribers in another list, that would come to a total of 2000 subscribers for the entire account. 

Certainly if you have any other questions around this or run into any issues, please feel free to reach out through this email and I'd be happy to help in any way that I can. We also have chat support available if you'd like more immediate help and myself or another agent would be happy to help out! 

I hope you have a good rest of your day! 

Thank you,
Kimberly

backlogTasks.title: HC-150 HC: Public/Private in Client Profile
RB-2740 TIME:  Custom Program Performance Report (OC)
backlogTasks.notes:
Customer is requesting a canned report to use as their Program Performance Report that has the ability to show the performance percentage by project type and individual project, and also the raw data/details used in calculating the measures.

Customer has provided an example of the current report: https://public.tableau.com/profile/casey.parnis#!/vizhome/2016HMISProjectPerformanceReport/FinalFinalPPR?publish=yes

Attached is an example of the report as requested from OC on May 5th. This is to serve example of what they were picturing for the summary report. The other three tabs contain the headers from their previous analysis spreadsheets with the columns that they created highlighted.

1.	Entries From Homelessness - Head of Household enrollments active during the reporting period that entered a qualifying project type from Type of Residence considered "homeless." 
2.	Successful Exits - Enrollments that exited from a qualifying project type to a Destination that is considered "successful" according to the HUD System Performance Report Programming Specifications (pg 40-41). 
3.	Leavers with Increased Income - Adult enrollments that increased their income (not including non-cash benefits) during their stay in a qualifying project and exited during the reporting period. 
4.	Stayers with Increased Income - Adult enrollments with a stay of at least 365 days that increased their income (not including non-cash benefits) during their stay in a qualifying project and were still enrolled in the project as of the end of the reporting period. 
5.	Enrollments that exited from an Other Permanent Housing or Permanent Supportive Housing project during the reporting period and have a permanent housing Destination OR enrollments in an Other Permanent Housing or Permanent Supportive Housing project that have remained in the project as of the end of the reporting period. 
6.	Recidivism - Enrollments of clients who exited a project during a two year period prior to the end of the reporting period and later returned to a project that qualified them as "homeless" at least 14 days after exiting from the original project. 
7.	Average Length of Stay - The average number of days between program start date and program end date OR the last day of the reporting period for all enrollments. 
8.	Average Number of Days to PH Placement - The average number of days between an enrollment's program start date and its Housing Move-In Date. 
9.	Unit Utilization - The number of bed nights provided by a project during the reporting period divided by the number of the number of the project's maximum number of possible bed nights during the reporting period.

Customer will provide more detailed specs for the above items upon approval.

backlogTasks.title: RB-2749 TIME:  YFHPI - Update Request for [KCWA-105] YFHPI Evaluation Random Assignment
backlogTasks.notes:
[~Natalie] -

The customer is asking for more changes... We are going to do an SOW this time... sigh. Please estimate how much time it would take to implement the following:

* Change randomization to only randomize for those with scores >14 and <29
* Change the hierarchy of the error messages to the following:
# If client has no signed ROI, then display *ROI message*.
# If client has a signed ROI but no Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the *Homeless Prevention Risk Tool* message.
# If client has a signed ROI and a completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool but no consent form, then display the *consent form* message.
# If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or above 29  completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the *score eligibility* message.
# Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored 15-28 on the risk tool, display *their group assignment*

Original request:

{quote}instance: kingcounty.clarityhs.com
report: \[KCWA-105\] YFHPI Evaluation Random Assignment
UI: 0140D9140
Reference: RB-2595 & RB-2708
Issue:
Customer is reporting that the client with a score of 30 on the assessment should not be randomized; because only clients with a score of 15-28 should be randomized. The logic will need to be updated as another change to the specifications, i.e score is > 28?  For reference, see RB-2595 :

bq. Logic and display of report results:
bq. 1. The client has a client consent form saved to their client record 
bq. The client has an assessment score > 14
bq. Result: 
bq. No change

Also, customer would like to ensure the hierarchy below applied is applied to error messages.


Customer writes:
We just saw a client (ID# 0140D9140) scored a 30 but was randomized into group B. I believe we had set it up so that only clients who score between 15-28 are eligible to be randomized, and an error message would appear for clients who score below 15 or above 28. Can you please check to make sure this error message is still in place?

In terms of the hierarchy of error messages, it would fall as follows:
# If client has no signed ROI, then display ROI message.
# If client has a signed ROI but no Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the Homeless Prevention Risk Tool message.
# If client has a signed ROI and a completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool but no consent form, then display the consent form message.
# If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or above 29  completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the score eligibility message.
# Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored 15-28 on the risk tool, display their group assignment J{quote}


      
      ~* Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.~

originalComments.body:
Hi [~dougt],

bq. *_The client needs to have one of the consent forms signed (NOT Including the “Client does not consent” or “Client withdrawal from study” forms) in order to be placed in a group.*_
>>>The report was updated to look *only* at client forms with "Consent for Participation" text in the form name.

bq. *_I tried running the report for a client with no consent form and it still returned Group B, when it should return message #3*_
>>>We need a client example. I've run the report for client BA13DFC86 (adult, has the assessment, doesn't have form) and got expected message:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

bq. *_A client who had not completed the consent form but scored >29 received Message #4 rather than #3*_
>>>We need a client example. I've run the report for client E4D53B17D (age = 29;  score = 35;  doesn't have form) and got expected message:
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Could you please take a look?

Best regards,
Natalie

[~Natalie], please find some additional information below provided by the customer this afternoon.

I tested it while logged in under the System and under Atlantic Street Center and it returned the same results. See below:

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

However I ran the report with client75D6DFC6A and received the correct message. Perhaps there is something strange about the previous test client (201DADDA4)?{quote}

originalComments.author: Natalie
originalComments.body:
Hi [~dougt],

Client 201DADDA4 *does* have Consent form ( https://kingcounty.clarityhs.com/clients/5526/files ):
!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!

Client 201DADDA4 has an assessment with score = 17 ( https://kingcounty.clarityhs.com/clients/5526/assessments ):
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

Not sure why I didn't notice it before but I have a question about score = 29. In most cases score = 29 is valid for Client to be plased in group. Please read task description:
bq. Change randomization to only randomize for those with scores >14 and *<29*
bq. If a client has a signed ROI and consent form, but scored <15 or *above 29* completed Homeless Prevention Risk Tool, then display the score eligibility message.
bq. Otherwise if a client has an ROI, consent form, and scored *15-28* on the risk tool, display their group assignment

It looks like "above 29" should be replaced with "above 28". Here can be the report issue because score = 29 was programmed as a valid score. Maybe that was the case? I've fixed the report. Could you please ask Customer to review?

Thank you,
Natalie
